metadata.role: Principal Product Manager, Gen AI Developer Tools
metadata.jobDescription:
Anaconda is seeking a Principal Product Manager, GenAI Developer Tools to join
their rapidly-growing company. 95% of Fortune 500 companies rely on Anaconda.

Key Responsibilities:
- Lead product strategy for Agentic Environment & Package Management initiatives
- MCP (Model Context Protocol) server development and AI tool integrations
- Drive development of tools and agents that improve Python vibe-coding quality
- Support strategic partnerships with AI-enabled IDEs (Cursor, VS Code, Windsurf)
- Define integration strategies making Anaconda indispensable to AI coding workflows
- Collaborate with engineering on APIs, SDKs, and developer tools
- Work with enterprise customers in regulated industries (finance, healthcare, gov)
- Partner with marketing and developer relations for 50M+ Python developers

Requirements:
- 7+ years PM experience, 3+ years in developer tools/infrastructure/platform
- Deep hands-on experience with AI coding tools (Cursor, GitHub Copilot, Claude)
- Proven expertise in MCP, A2A protocol, agentic systems
- API design, system architecture, implementation trade-offs
- Experience building strategic technology partnerships
- Track record driving product adoption in developer communities

hero.subheadline: Developer tools PM with 8+ years shipping SDKs, CLIs, and infrastructure that developers actually want to use. From Flow's 60% faster onboarding to Ankr.JS powering 1M+ daily API calls—I build the tools that make complex systems feel simple.

about.tagline: Eight years shipping developer tools that bridge the gap between powerful infrastructure and delightful DX.
bio:
I've spent my career making complex infrastructure accessible to developers. At Dapper Labs, I led the Flow CLI and Cadence Playground redesign that cut developer onboarding time by 60%—turning a churning funnel into a growth engine. At Ankr, I built the Ankr.JS SDK and Advanced APIs that powered 1M+ daily requests, driving 15× revenue growth by making RPC infrastructure feel invisible. At Forte, I designed Wallet-as-a-Service SDKs that let AAA gaming studios add Web3 features without learning blockchain.
What excites me about Anaconda is the {{accent}}MCP and agentic systems work{{/accent}}. I've been deep in AI-assisted development—using Cursor and Claude daily, building my own MCP servers, and thinking hard about what developer tools look like when agents are first-class users. The opportunity to shape how 50M+ Python developers interact with AI tools is exactly where I want to be.

caseStudies.reasoning: SDK development (Ankr.JS), API design, driving developer adoption, 15× growth—directly maps to building developer tools and driving adoption
Platform PM experience, framework design, cross-functional coordination with engineering teams
Enterprise-scale technical PM, API design, pioneering new technology paradigm at large org
Enterprise customers in regulated industries, infrastructure platform, working with finance clients
